Semmelweis University Computational Biology Group
Group NewsResearchPeoplePublicationsPositionsResources

This is an evolving list of papers, how-tos, large-scale genomics datasets, computing resources and other interesting things.

Reading material for genomics, bioinformatics and science

  • A collection of papers for absolute beginners, on reproducibility, version control, bioinformatics pipelines, statistics, Linux and programming.
  • Reading list to get you started in computational biology, cancer, genomics, transcriptomics, chromatin and molecular biology in general.
  • A rather short guide on how to survive in the lab. Trying to improve it in the near future.
  • Jeff Leek has a bunch of guides on how to share data, develop an R package, give a talk, write your first paper, read papers, review papers, plan your career.

Websites and databases

  • The Cancer Genome Atlas
  • International Cancer Genome Consortium
  • Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
  • Encyclopedia of DNA Elements
  • Roadmap Epigenomics Project
  • A BLUEPRINT of Haematopoietic Epigenomes
  • Genotype-Tissue Expression Project
  • The Geuvadis Project
  • 1000 Genomes Project
  • Human Cell Atlas
  • Library of Integrated Network-Based Cellular Signatures
  • Human Induced Pluripotent Stem Cell Initiative
  • The Human Protein Atlas

Computing resources

  • MTA Cloud for academic researchers
  • Hungarian Supercomputing Infrastructure

Scientific societies

  • Hungarian Society for Bioinformatics
  • Hungarian Genetics Society
  • Hungarian Biochemical Society
  • Hungarian Cancer Society
  • Hungarian Society of Human Genetics

Miscellanea

  • Tools and planners for meetings, collaboration, writing and task management
